name: Casa Zavalla
description: Casa Zavalla is an heritage house in Santa Rosa. It was original used to store unmilled rice (palay). In 1989, Arch. Mario Zavalla restored the house and then, it becomes the repository of Santa Rosa artifacts. The Casa also serves as the venue of "Kapihan" to discuss things like preserving the historical heritage.
address: F. Gomez corner Anonuevo Streets, 708, Santa Rosa
